tool.name: make_ecs_dir

param.name: output_path
param.dialogReference: The ECS run folder, where a new ECS input GDB, output GDB, and folder to contain spreadsheet outputs will be created. Example of suggested naming pattern: "ECS_Run_Jun2022".

param.name: in_conslands
param.dialogReference: Input conservation lands feature class. A copy of the original conservation lands and a BMI-flattened version of will be output to the ECS inputs geodatabase.

param.name: in_elExclude
param.dialogReference: Input element exclusions table(s). If more than one table is provided, they are merged into a new table using Create Element Exclusion List.

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference:
Input Procedural Features feature class (optional). This defaults to the Biotics query (DLINK) layer, in which case the data is extracted directly from Biotics. You can also provide a previously-extracted version of the procedural features feature class that was output from the "Extract Biotics Data" tool. The data will be parsed by site type, with outputs placed in the new ECS inputs geodatabase.

This parameter is optional. If you skip it, you should manually copy the PF feature class(es) to the ECS inputs geodatabase.

param.name: in_ConSites
param.dialogReference:
Input Conservation Sites feature class (optional). This defaults to the Biotics query (DLINK) layer, in which case the data is extracted directly from Biotics. You can also provide a previously-extracted version of the ConSites feature class that was output from the "Extract Biotics Data" tool. The data will be parsed by site type, with outputs placed in the new ECS inputs geodatabase.

This parameter is optional. If you skip it, you should manually copy the ConSite feature class(es) to the ECS inputs geodatabase.

tool.summary: Prepares an existing directory for an Essential ConSite (ECS) run. Creates input and output geodatabases, a folder to hold Excel spreadsheet outputs, and populates the input geodatabase with a merged element exclusions table, original and BMI-flattened conservation lands, and procedural features and conservation sites, parsed by site type.
